title: Eksamen IIKG3020 (2021) â€” Multiple Choice Questions (45 points)
description: Multiple Choice Questions from the IIKG3020 exam 2021. Use for practice and self-testing.

questions.question: In the current cyber threat landscape, which threat actor category has the highest sophistication, resource level and commitment?
Which botnet was behind the DDoS attack against Dyn in 2016?
choices: Mirai: A botnet consisting of IoT devices with hardcoded usernames and passwords
Mariposa: A botnet based on the Palevo worm spreading through pirated software, P2P networks and USB thumb drives
ZeuS: A botnet spread through massive phishing campaigns

questions.question: What are the most commonly observed attack vectors for volumetric DDoS attacks in the current threat landscape?
What comes first in the incident response planning process?
choices: Create incident response strategies and procedures

questions.question: Which CSIRT organizational model is most commonly found in smaller organisations?
choices: Internal combined distributed and centralized CSIRT

questions.question: Which of these CSIRT services is a proactive service?
Which of these CSIRT services is a reactive service?
Which standard maintained by FIRST specifies a scoring system for rating the severity of vulnerabilities?

Which TLP marking should be used for sharing information that requires support to be effectively acted upon, but carries risk to privacy, reputation, or operations if shared outside of the organizations involved?
Which of these incident indicators is an example of a definite indicator of an actual incident?
Which intrusion detection approach is best for detecting malware infections using encrypted channels for command and control?
How can passive DNS be used in incident response?
choices: For threat hunting, pivoting indicators of compromise
For sharing of indicators between CSIRTs to implement better IDS signatures
For threat intelligence, learning the attackers TTPs
As a sandbox for dynamic malware analysis

questions.question: Which of these indicators of malicious code indicates a possible ransomware infection?
choices: Sudden increase in the number of e-mails being sent
Unexpected dialog boxes requesting permission to do something
Suspicious processes renaming and encrypting files
New icons appearing on the desktop

questions.question: In what phase in the intrusion kill chain model is antivirus a useful course of action?
Which of these is a typical infection vector for APT malware?
Which of these decoys require the least amount of data monitoring?
Which of these tools is used for sharing of indicators of compromise between CSIRTS?
Which of these actions is NOT a containment, eradication or recovery action?
choices: Determine whether an incident has occurred
Confirm that the affected systems are functioning normally

questions.question: In what phase in the intrusion kill chain model is data execution prevention (DEP) a useful course of action?
What type of incident response plan testing requires the least time and resources?
choices: Live technical exercise in a cyber range

questions.question: What comes first of these steps in the incident handling workflow?
Who should be on top of the list of who to communicate with in a ransomware incident?
Who should be on top of the list of who to communicate with in a DDoS incident?
What would a CVSS score of 10.0 indicate?
choices: This is a very critical vulnerability
This is a vulnerability of minor severity
This is a very common software security weakness

questions.question: What framework describes a standardized process for the disclosure of vulnerabilities?
What tool would be most helpful for static malware analysis?
What tool would be most helpful for dynamic malware analysis?
Which of these measures do you think would be the best performance indicator for measuring CSIRT effectiveness?
choices: Number of incidents reported per year
Number of hours spent on resolving incidents per team member per year

questions.question: When evaluating an intrusion detection system (IDS), which of these would you prefer?
choices: An IDS with few false positives and many false negatives
An IDS with many false positives and few false negatives
An IDS with few false positives and few false negatives
An IDS with many false positives and many false negatives

questions.question: What can organisations do to avoid becoming part of the problem and misused as reflectors in DDoS attacks on others?
choices: Monitor BGP traffic to detect IP hijacking
Stress-test own infrastructure to determine bottle-necks
Scan for misconfigured, abusable services in own network
Monitor DDoS backscatter traffic in darknets

questions.question: Which of these acronyms represent the newest type of detection and response tools?
What does "dwell time" refer to?
choices: The average amount of time it takes for an incident handler to resolve an incident
The average amount of time an attacker spends in the reconnaissance phase before getting initial access to a system
The average amount of time an IoT device is part of a DDoS botnet before it gets cleaned up
The average amount of time an APT threat actor spends inside a system before they get detected by incident responders

questions.question: What comes last of these in the cyber attack life cycle?
What TLP level would you use when sharing indicators of compromise in a digital espionage incident involving nation-state threat actors?
Which of these is the most important when performing computer forensics?
choices: Maintaining the chain of custody of any evidence
Following the cyber kill chain methodology

questions.question: What is the definition of a zero-day vulnerability?
choices: A vulnerability that does not have a proof-of-concept exploit available
A vulnerability that has not yet been announced to the public
A vulnerability that is publicly known, but has not got a patch available
A vulnerability that is currently exploited "in the wild"

questions.question: Which one of these claims related to legal frameworks for CSIRT information sharing is true?
choices: GDPR does not allow CSIRTS to share information containing personal data
The draft of NIS2D gives a weaker legal provision for CSIRT information sharing than GDPR
CSIRTs are encouraged to share information for the purposes of ensuring network and information security as long as it is performed within their legitimate interest
GDPR is not applicable to CSIRT information sharing

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using an intelligence feedback loop in computer network defense?
choices: It enables defenders to establish a state of information superiority
It increases the adversary's likelihood of success with each subsequent intrusion attempt
It helps defenders fixing the flaws that resulted in the compromise by root cause analysis
It increases the defender's likelihood of discovering new vulnerabilities in their own systems with each subsequent intrusion attempt

questions.question: Which one of these claims about ATT&CK is true?
choices: ATT&CK is a kind of Wikipedia on cyberattacks with a focus on indicators that are on top of the "Pyramid of Pain"
ATT&CK is a kind of Wikipedia of Indicators of Compromise
ATT&CK includes all levels of the "Pyramid of Pain"
ATT&CK describes all actions an adversary takes before the point of compromise

questions.question: What is DETT&CT?
choices: An update to ATT&CK developed by MITRE
A framework assisting blue teams to map their detection coverage to ATT&CK
A scoring system for implementation of ATT&CK IDS signatures
The red team version of ATT&CK

questions.question: What is the advantage of intrusion reconstruction using the cyber kill chain from the defender's point of view?
choices: It enables the defenders to move their detection and analysis to the latter phases of the kill chain
It enables defenders to initiate the incident response to after the exploit phase
It forces the adversary to adjust their actions on objectives
It forces an adversary to change every phase of their intrusion in order to achieve their goals in subsequent intrusions

questions.question: What is threat hunting?
choices: Analysis driven by AI using ML to inform defenders
Proactively and systematically looking for signs of cyber intrusions

questions.question: A newly disclosed vulnerability can lead to remote code execution, has low attack complexity, does not require any privileges or user interaction to be exploited and impacts confidentiality, integrity and availability to a high degree. What would be the most likely CVSS version 3 score?
The Java logging library Log4j contains a critical vulnerability that can lead to remote code execution by logging a specially crafted string. What common software weakness is this an example of?

A critical vulnerability is announced in a very popular Java software library. A patch is available, but there are rumours going on Twitter about the patch not actually fixing the flaw. You are an MSSP running 24/7 SOC services and managing firewalls and IDPS systems for your customers. Which of these actions would you prioritise first for your team to start working on:
choices: Create a threat advisory for your customers
Apply the patch to your customers systems
Investigate if any of your own systems are affected by the vulnerability
Initiate threat hunting on historical logs to figure out if any of your customers have been exploited
